page.title: 19Olveston C of E School.
page.content: Mr. Herbert Peart is the headmaster of Olveston Church of England School and has been for the past twelve years. The school has six classes (2 infant and 4 junior) with approximately 170 children. The school is a typical small village school which not only serves the local community but has children travelling in from eleven other smaller villages. To run a school this size it costs about Â£100,000 per annum. To run the school the headmaster has help from six teachers, a secretary, one welfare assistant, a cook and two helps plus three supervisors. Lessons consist of work in Maths, Computors, English, History, Geography, R.E., Science, Art and Craft.These lessons are supported by educational visits to museums, castles, theatres and generally places of interest.
